definition: unauthorized (especially deliberate) disclosure of confidential information, have an opening that allows light or substances to enter or go out
details:
noun
- unauthorized (especially deliberate) disclosure of confidential information
= synonyms: news leak
- the discharge of a fluid from some container
= synonyms: escape
- an accidental hole that allows something (fluid or light etc.) to enter or escape
= example: an accidental hole that allows something (fluid or light etc.) to enter or escape
- an impolite euphemism for urination
= example: an impolite euphemism for urination
= synonyms: wetting
- soft watery rot in fruits and vegetables caused by fungi
verb
- have an opening that allows light or substances to enter or go out
= example: have an opening that allows light or substances to enter or go out
- enter or escape as through a hole or crack or fissure
= example: enter or escape as through a hole or crack or fissure
- to divulge or reveal
= example: to divulge or reveal
= synonyms: leak out
- tell anonymously
= example: tell anonymously
